case_vignette: A 64-year-old man is admitted with a history of altered mental status. He was in his usual state of health until a few days ago when he has started to become confused, lethargic, forgetful, and repeating the same questions. Over the last few days, he sometimes appears perfectly normal, and, at other times, he has difficulty recognizing his family members. Yesterday, he was screaming that the room was filled with snakes. Past medical history is significant for type 2 diabetes mellitus, managed medically, and chronic kidney disease, for which he undergoes regular hemodialysis on alternate days. There is no history of smoking, alcohol use, or illicit drug use. His vitals include: blood pressure 129/88 mm Hg, pulse 112/min, temperature 38.2°C (100.8°F), and respiratory rate 20/min. The patient is oriented only to person and place. His mini-mental state examination (MMSE) score is 18/30, where he had difficulty performing basic arithmetic calculations and recalled only 1 out of 3 objects. Nuchal rigidity is absent. Muscle strength is 5/5 bilaterally.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Neurology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been feeling confused, lethargic, forgetful, and I've been asking the same questions over and over.
How old are you?
I am 64 years old.
Do you have any existing medical conditions or take any medications?
Yes, I have type 2 diabetes and chronic kidney disease, and I regularly undergo hemodialysis.
Do you have a family history of any neurological conditions such as Alzheimer's disease or dementia?
The information provided doesn't mention anything about my family history, so I don't know.
Understood. Thank you for providing the information. Based on your symptoms and medical history, I recommend further evaluation by a neurologist.

How old are you?
I am 64 years old.

**Final Diagnosis:** Cognitive Impairment due to Diabetes and Chronic Kidney Disease
